title.rendered: Iceland continue magical football run by qualifying for World Cup

content.rendered:
Every World Cup tournament, since its creation, has seen at least one team making its first appearance in the tournament and after Iceland secured their ticket to Russia this evening, the trend continues.

Having beaten Kosovo 2-0 on home soil this evening, Iceland, boasting a mere population of 334,000, have topped Group I and become the smallest nation to ever qualify for a World Cup.

Their first appearance in an international tournament altogether came in Euro 2016, when they were the complete surprise package and famously knocked out England before being beaten by France in the quarter finals. And now, they’ve gone one better by finishing first on 22 points, following victory in their final qualifier tonight.

Goals from Everton midfielder Gylfi Sigurdsson and Berg Gudmundsson got the job done, and sparked typically incredible scenes after the final whistle.

The players and supporters all performed their trademark ‘Viking’ clap in stereo and it was utterly incredible.

Here’s how the rest of social media reacted:

 Final whistle and first emotions. Iceland, it was unforgettable. #Russia2018#WorldCup pic.twitter.com/vmfQJrmYgF
– Alex Mandziy (@OleksiyTheFirst) October 9, 2017

 Five years ago, Iceland were ranked 131st in the world.

Now – they’ve just qualified for their first-ever World Cup!

:soccer::clap::flag_is: pic.twitter.com/UO061OYq5O
– FourFourTweet (@FourFourTweet) October 9, 2017

 Iceland at home in the 2018 World Cup qualifying campaign:

WWWWW

Goals: 10
Conceded: 2
Clean sheets: 4

:ok_hand: pic.twitter.com/8TpdNhDyye
– Squawka Football (@Squawka) October 9, 2017

 Huge congrats to Iceland for becoming the smallest nation ever to qualify for a World Cup! Surely they can’t repeat their Euros success?!
– Spencer FC (@SpencerOwen) October 9, 2017

 Iceland (population ~340K) is the smallest country ever to qualify for the World Cup, by ~1M people. :flag_is:

Previous record: 2006 T&T (~1.3M).
– Paul Carr (@PCarrESPN) October 9, 2017

 :flag_is: Iceland’s population is less than that of Coventry, Ealing and Wakefield.

:clap: The smallest nation ever to qualify for a World Cup. pic.twitter.com/LbV3jcFlWt
– bet365 (@bet365) October 9, 2017

 England fans seeing that Iceland have qualified for the World Cup pic.twitter.com/EuhB0hltTJ
– KR:leo: (@kartikr99) October 9, 2017

 QUALIFIED! :raised_hands:
Congratulations, :flag_is:Iceland! :clap:
The smallest nation ever to reach a #WorldCup! See you in :flag_ru:Russia! #WCQpic.twitter.com/Xy1ysyLdpA
– #WCQ :soccer::trophy: (@FIFAWorldCup) October 9, 2017

 Iceland have qualified for their first ever World Cup. They’re a bloody good side. Only losing 2-1 to them now looks a triumph…ish.
– Gary Lineker (@GaryLineker) October 9, 2017

 With population of only 330 000, Iceland is the first nation with a population under 1 million to qualify for the World Cup. :blue_heart::heart_eyes::flag_is: #WC2018
– Everything Napoli (@NaplesAndNapoli) October 9, 2017

They are going to create an atmosphere like no other when June rolls around!
